CatDescriptText: Mr. David Betts, Beltzhoover and Mr. Patrick McComville, student, New Kensington, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, September 16, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think that political party policy makers respect the Negro vote and act accordingly, or do they take it for granted?  Why?" Mr. Betts' answer reads: "They take the vote for granted, because we're second class citizens although not of our own desire." Mr. McComville's answer reads: "I don't think the parties really appreciate Negro votes and instead take them for granted."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of David Betts wearing light colored short sleeve polo shirt, standing in front of truck with logo marked "Good"; Portrait of Patrick McComville wearing eyeglasses, standing in front of truck
